## Why?

* Consistency and project organisation will help you: work with collaborators, get feedback on code, publish your analyses.

* Consistency also helps with troubleshooting

## Collaborators
### Who is a collaborator?

* Your current and future coworkers

* Your future self

## Important things: 

* Functional analyses

* Reproducible analyses

* Organisation

* Clear annotation

* Consistent formatting

* Elegance (using functions and iterations)

## Manipulating data with dplyr

* `select()`

* `filter()`

* `arrange()`

* `mutate()`

* `group_by`


---

## Penguins data

```{r, echo = F, message = F, warning = F}
library(palmerpenguins)
```

```{r}
glimpse(penguins)
```
---

```{r}
summary(penguins)
```

---

## select()

```{r}
penguins %>% 
  select(species, island, body_mass_g) %>% #<<
  head()

```
---

## arrange()

```{r}
penguins %>% 
  select(species, island, body_mass_g) %>% 
  arrange(desc(body_mass_g)) %>% #<<
  head()
```

---

## filter()

```{r}
penguins %>% 
  select(species, island, body_mass_g) %>% 
  arrange(desc(body_mass_g)) %>% 
  filter(body_mass_g <= 5000) %>% #<<
  head()
```
---
## mutate()

### Creating a new variable

```{r}
penguins %>% 
  mutate(size_class = if_else(#<<
    body_mass_g > 4050, 
    "large", 
    "small"), 
    .before = island) %>% 
  head()
```
---

## group_by()
### perform functions on a grouping basis

```{r, message = FALSE}
penguins %>% 
  group_by(species, island) %>% #<<
  summarise(n = n())

```
